channel.title: Need help with an old game
channel.description:
Ok, ive got this game from 1994, I wanna play it, the stock 2 levels get boring hella fast, its shareware and it has the save and save as buttons for designing a level disabled. If any one has the free version, can find a crack, or can modify this one for me so I can design.... well... i would be really grateful? lol I cant really offer anything, but the game itself, if nothing else you can play the two levels that come with it. I uploaded it to tiny pic hosting, just rename .rar and extract.
[center]http://i50.tinypic.com/2br7ly.jpg[/center]
[right] Thanks a million! TKing[/right]

item.title: Need help with an old game
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:16, topic:327670”][quote author=Hiaburi link=topic=424056.msg3115322#msg3115322 date=1264908987]
Yea, it would be kick ass if you could save designs wouldn’t it? I remember when i first got it making a sweet level and spending like 10 hours doing it only to find out i couldnt save lol
[/quote]

I remember getting Venture in an old shareware disc back in the CD-Rom era and doing the same thing. I haven’t ever seen a cracked version of it, it’s too old and obscure for something like that to be floating around. If I ever get done with my current project I might look into unlocking that shit, probably isn’t too hard. Venture is odd; it plays like a multimedia version of an early text based interactive fiction game and it’s based on .bmps and .wavs. You might have to actually contact Richard Foley at 17 Morning Glen Lane Newark Delaware to get the full version. That’s how Shareware is supposed to work anyway. Maybe Richard just got depressed and killed himself after playing The Elder Scrolls: Arena which also came out in 1994, because his game isn’t very exciting in comparison. Good luck.[/quote]

Well if you do, lemme know. I’ll try to contact him, I just assumed he would have moved by now

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with an old game

item.title: Need help with an old game
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Hiaburi:

Yea, it would be kick ass if you could save designs wouldn’t it? I remember when i first got it making a sweet level and spending like 10 hours doing it only to find out i couldnt save lol

I remember getting Venture in an old shareware disc back in the CD-Rom era and doing the same thing. I haven’t ever seen a cracked version of it, it’s too old and obscure for something like that to be floating around. If I ever get done with my current project I might look into unlocking that shit, probably isn’t too hard. Venture is odd; it plays like a multimedia version of an early text based interactive fiction game and it’s based on .bmps and .wavs. You might have to actually contact Richard Foley at 17 Morning Glen Lane Newark Delaware to get the full version. That’s how Shareware is supposed to work anyway. Maybe Richard just got depressed and killed himself after playing The Elder Scrolls: Arena which also came out in 1994, because his game isn’t very exciting in comparison. Good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with an old game
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

Sorry really bad at describing stuff, lemme try again, that picture has a .rar in it, rename it to .rar and you can extract the game, in the folder is a setup folder, in there is a setup.exe, that will install the game.

I’ve had this game for ~16 years and ive never found a crack or full version, hell ive never even found the demo download online any where. I am asking for any one who is good at cracking to unlock the design module for it, should be simple enough, i just don’t have any experience.

Read full topic
